page.title: 04LONGBURTON CHURCH
page.content: The tower of St James the Great at Longburton dated from the mid l3th century with typical Early English lancet windows. The bell chamber containing four bells was added in the l6th or l7th century. The latest portion of the church is the North aisle added in l873 when more seating accommodation was needed. The population of Longburton was then at its highest water mark. The north chapel was built in the early l7th century and contains two impressive canopied monuments. One is to Sir John Fitzjames and his wife Joan and the other to Thomas Winston, his son and wife. A project to recover the church kneelers with canvas embroidery was started in l976 by Mrs Carsan and these were dedicated by Bishop Pike in l978.l2
